description: Minimalist, stable bedrock for the MCP ecosystem. Exposes capability tools via compliant JSON-RPC 2.0 over WebSocket. Strictly separates Logic from IO.

components.rpc.js: Handles transport, message validation, and error normalization
components.loader.js: Discovers and registers tools from /tools directory

contract.separation: Files must be split into *.logic.js (pure) and *.io.js (side-effects)
contract.registry: All tools must be exported via tools/index.ts
contract.errors: All failures must be thrown as ToolError

principles: Logic/IO Separation: Business logic is testable without mocks.
Bounded Execution: Operations have strict timeouts and size limits.
Statelessness: Tools do not retain state between calls (except via global mcpState).
Explicit Surface: Only registered tools are callable.

security.guards: IO operations are gatekept by config/limits.js
security.validation: Input schemas are strictly enforced per tool
security.isolation: Server Kernel has zero knowledge of Agent/Bridge concepts
